title: Radiation Therapy Technologist (Rtt) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: "What radiotherapy and imaging techniques are used in your department? What version of Varian machine do you have, i.e. Clinic or TrueBeam? Finally, I am mostly experienced in treatment delivery, are staff expected to rotate through planning also?"
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Mental Health Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (White Plains, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well in my opinion. I had a great time and I enjoyed my conversation with Ms. Ross. The position sounds very exciting and I am glad to be given the opportunity to grow professionally within the agency.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for the float pool Psychiatric Technician position?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview. No tricky questions. Mostly why you want to become a data analyst. I heard back the next day after the interview. Two interviews total. Nothing else. An offer was not as good as the other offers.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions. No tricky questions.

title: Social Worker LMSW Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR, then LCSW on unit, then director of social work of unit interviewed for. All were about 30 minutes. Personable. Balance of basic interview questions regarding why there and previous work experience, strengths. And telling me about the position
Interview Questions: Past experiences in the field and in other clinical opportunities. Why I am interested in this specific population.

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Queens, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed and professional. I met with a few people and the interview process was very pleasant. Everyone I met with was very down to earth and welcoming. The interview lasted about 45 minutes and I had a very good feeling about it afterwards.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work here?

title: Nursing Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews: 1 with a recruiter and 1 with a nurse manager. Both were super kind and friendly. No nursing-related questions. They asked behavioral questions; 2nd interview was more difficult.
Interview Questions: Why nursing? What unit would you like to work on? A time you've gone above and beyond for the patient. Lots of questions about dealing with coworkers.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: I first met my recruiter during a Lunch-and-Learn event to get to know the hospital and units. I talked with my recruiter in person about what positions I am interested in. Later on, I was contacted by my recruiter and arranged another in-person interview with nurse managers. We had a great interview and I was taken for a tour of the unit by another nurse to have a better understanding of the position and working environment. I contacted my recruiter afterward and consulted the estimated time to know the result. A reference link was sent to me and I noticed that they'd like to give me an offer. After I completed the references, a written offer, and questionnaires were sent to me. I accepted the offer and waiting for the next step now.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself What makes you want to be a nurse Tell us about your experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: new grad nurse position. Had an interview with human resource then the managers. Both were a zoom call. the whole process was smooth and everyone got back to me pretty quick
Interview Questions: Why choose did you choose New york Presbyterian

title: Nurse Companion Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was an online video interview, and it was only yes or no questions. IT was pretty simple and straight foward. Then they sent me an interview questionnaire which also had basic questions.
Interview Questions: Are you graduating in may 2024

title: Registered Nurse Emergency Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: With he recruiter pretty straightforward questions. You'll be set to meet with the department managers after this initial interview. Come with questions to avoid a short interview and awkward silence. Also look into what new things the hospital is implementing to show your interest
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the Emergency room? Do you know which location you applied to? Was there a time in clinical where you had to correct a staff member of your clinical site and what did you do? Why NYP?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process would recommend to anyone applying in the hospital. its a good place to work and to grow, simple interview with recruiter and than with the heads of dept
Interview Questions: Where you see yourself in 5 years

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Called in for in person interview via email - i interviewed with two people( manager and lead tech) and it was 30 min long, they didn’t ask anything crazy or difficult
Interview Questions: What are some of your weaknesses

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, then interview with HR, then interview with nurse manager, then interview with nurse educator and one person from floor unit. All this within 2 weeks after applying for the job,
Interview Questions: Why you chose New York presbisterian?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very lax, no curveball questions and overall very easy. Introduced myself and my previous experience, why nursing, why that specific unit, how I overcame conflict in the workplace. Definitely overprepared but ended up improvising during the actual interview
Interview Questions: why nursing, why that specific unit, how I overcame conflict in the workplace

title: RN Labor and Delivery Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied Jan 2023, application was showing as submitted. Then, about 10 days later it show as under consideration or something similar. I received an email to schedule an interview with HR with multiple slots for availability in a 3 week window or so. It was a very unusual interview, the manager went straight to ask me how long I was doing L&D and after telling her a little over a year(position i applied for was listed as req 1 yd lnd) the person said she could not hire me for the position i applied which was days part time lnd and went on to offer full time nights. It has been the more awkward interview I ever had...
Interview Questions: How many years of experience as an lnd nurse?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and more on interpersonal questions. It was a panel interview and a formal panel interview. The panel was consist of manager of the unit and HR patient safety manager
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict

title: Pharmacisst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview is via Zoom, which includes several pharmacy managers. It starts with self introductions, then proceeds to managers asking questions, and finally applicant will get a turn to get more info.
Interview Questions: Questions include why did you apply for this position, your strengths and weaknesses, a few on handling difficult situation/conflicts with coworkers.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I was called by the nurse recruiter and scheduled for a zoom interview the next week. One with the recruiter and the second with a panel of nurses from the floor. Standard interview otherwise.
Interview Questions: Why nursing? How have you handled conflict? Clinical experience?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was sweet and short, very nice. not intimidating. just know the basic interview questions. dont worry about it that much. you have to show your confidence throughout the interview.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself, why nyp

title: Nursing Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very smoothly. I had two interviews in one day, one with the director of nursing and the other with the nursing recruiter. Both were friendly & made me feel comfortable throughout the entire interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you’re interested in working as a CNA for New York Presbyterian?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Quick, 15-30 mins, but professional. The manager took the time to get to know me and find out if I was a good fit for the job; explained what the job entailed to help me decide if this also aligned with my career goal.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself What is your availability

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview was brief and consisted of basic questions. There were some unexpected questions on experiences that were not mentioned as required in the job description. Expected salary was asked upfront.
Interview Questions: Do you have any project management experience? Why NYP?

title: Project Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The zoom interview process was the shortest and the most unprofessional I have experienced. Without any introduction I was asked to introduce myself, right after my introduction I was asked about my RC experience (I explained the project I worked on for RC) . There was uncomfortable silence and when I asked questions that's when I found information which was relevant but not emphasized on the job posting . The feeling I was left with was awful. What a waste of 15minutes but great experience about what type of leadership and culture that role is in.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with Revenue Cycle?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Mostly interviews via zoom. more conversationalist than question and answers. multiple interviewers. Fairly straightforward interview. questions based on department being applied for, fair questions. experienced two interviews, each for 15- 30 minutes each.
Interview Questions: what makes you stand out as an applicant?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Be sure to ask for follow-up and for when to reach back. The interview was well and there is clear communication between both parties. Be sure to make sure you are interviewing for the correct position as it may cause confusion.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this career.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the HR recruiter on the phone first then the manager of the floor then the workers on the floor. Overall it was a smooth interview process and each question was easy to answer.
Interview Questions: When is a time you have had to deal with a difficult patient and how did you handle it?

title: Senior Medical Laboratory Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process went smoothly. Sometimes it would be nice to speak to an HR. Connect Coordinator. The process took some time to get all the paperwork in. The overall process seems a bit long, but it worked out pretty well.
Interview Questions: How soon I can start the new position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and smooth process from start to finish. I was very nervous at the start, but the recruiter was able to calm my nerves. Recruiter was very nice and knowledgable about the company and position.
Interview Questions: they asked about strengths and weaknesses

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quite Fine but these people let me put in my resignation from my other job only to hear couple days before my start date that I didn’t get the job for a high school Diploma that I didnt need that is so messed up
Interview Questions: Why would I work here ? Why would i change career fields ?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: One unscheduled phone interview with HR, then one zoom with future boss. Had two other zoom interviews with other team members. Took about 1.5 months from application to hire. I had another offer and they were able to move fast to match it.
Interview Questions: What was my experience with healthcare marketing?

title: Analytics & Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Received rejection letter immediately after submission of application because I indicated that I will need sponsorship in the future, though none of the job posting have mentioned that NYP will not provide sponsorship
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current employer?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: After applying to a certain position, a recruiter might reach out to discuss the roles of the job you applied for. Despite applying for a certain shift, if you have no experience, they will recommend you for the night shift (depending on the unit needs).
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well. Very smooth process. They asked the typical strength and weakness questions in addition to describing times where I displayed teamwork. My answers were very simple and straight to the point while keeping things light.
Interview Questions: what are you're strengths and weaknesses? Describe a time where you had to show teamwork

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: If you are looking to apply to work at New York-Presbyterian, then I would suggest not to. After recuriters complete a phone screening. Next, they schedule a interview with the hiring manager. Instead of them following up with candidates or taking time to update their NYP careers account. They just forget about contacting candidates and donot even bother to follow-up with status. I will waste my time applying for NYP due to its unprofessionalism, lack of communication, and not taking candidates seriously.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Brooklyn, NY) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position on the Infonet and received an email confirmation. A few weeks later I interviewed via zoom. Once the position was confirmed I received an offer letter from HR and accepted.
Interview Questions: To give an example of how I may have helped another co-worker.

title: Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very quick and precise. The questions are not hard and also limited, I was only asked maybe 3 questions.  My interview was maybe ten minutes through a zoom call.
Interview Questions: They asked emergency room scenario questions

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Through zoom first. Very friendly and relaxed setting. Will go over the next steps of hiring, job description. Have room for questions.  Usual interview questions, it is not difficult. Interviewer is very friendly and not intimidating.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was very nervous, at the beginning. The interviewer was calm and it made me feel relaxed. They ask questions that where related to the job, and where patient with my answers, and provided me with time to fully express myself.
Interview Questions: They presented me with a scenario, and had me respond to how I would handle it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was good. The recruiter and team members were welcoming. I felt that this new york presbyterian would be a great fit for me. I am happy to have the opportunity to interview for the organization.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose NYP?

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Brooklyn, NY) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straight forward and involved being asked questions about times I faced difficulty/hardship and how I went about handling it. The interview was virtual and the managers were very friendly.
Interview Questions: Name a time you faced difficulty and explain how you handled it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call from HR, which connected with nursing managers at unit. Quick virtual interview with basic questions that screened behavioral, interest, and gave information on the unit, tasks involved. Very insightful. Easy process.
Interview Questions:
-Tell me about a time you had to advocate for yourself
-Tell me about a time you had to work as a team, and how that was beneficial over working independently.

title: Clinical Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: 6 interviews , management, medical director , nurse director PCD team and coworkers . We interviewed through zoom. Was asked questions about my goals and leadership styles, and my reasoning for a change .
Interview Questions: Was I ready to transition from staff nurse to CNM

title: Candidate Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Process was pretty simple. First up was a video interview- you do not speak to anyone, just go on camera and answer some questions. I soon after received an email for an interview with some team members (virtual). The process went well and for the most part was a good experience. What was disappointing was that they emphasized how important candidate experience was, and that no candidate that interviewed would be left without a response. Well I was. I know companies interview loads of people, but to be told I’d receive a response and have them completely ghost seemed a bit unprofessional to me.
Interview Questions: The usual, tell me about a difficult experience at work, how did you deal with it, standard interviewing 101.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The process was straightforward and fair. The manager took the time to get to know me and allowed me to be myself. I was offered the position soon after the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation with a patient.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: A very friendly and motivational environment.  I did not feel intimidated, instead it felt great answering my questions and I was given a chance to elaborate on my achievements and what I could continue to do to excel more.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult situation with a coworker or a patient.

title: Inventory implant analyst  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were two separate interviews on different days. Effective communication for interview dates allowed me prepare for the interview. First interview was with a recruiter, and the second one was with one of the bosses in the supply chain field.
Interview Questions: Why I chose NYP in my career search.

title: Patient Care Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Already having a role here at NYP made the process very streamline. I knew all the people that I was interviewing with and the process from start to finish was only about 2 weeks before I was notified of the answer.
I had 6 interviews over those 2 weeks
Interview Questions: How can I better the relationship among the units in Cohen Hospital?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very smoothly. I was impressed by the efficiency of the entire process. The hiring managers were very thorough in answering all of my questions and describing the available positions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Croton-on-Hudson, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was excellent; the interviewer asked me many questions regarding my previous job experience and current job.  That was a present experience to talk with her; after the interview, the interviewer told me they would contact me within a week, but they never, so that was a pretty sad part. Other than that, it was a kind of a good experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me a challenging situation that you have overcome

title: Clinical Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (White Plains, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with HR and was offered a second interview with the head of the nutrition department and another clinical RD. The interview was scheduled on zoom and I received a link. I was early and waited 30 minutes into the interview and NO ONE showed up. No one followed up. I emailed the HR contact and she replied “apologies, give me additional times you are available” and against my better judgment I replied with my availability. I never heard back. Appalled at the lack of respect for someone’s time and lack of accountability. Completely unprofessional. 10/10 do not recommend pursing a career with New York Presbyterian unless you want to be treated as disposable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.. tell me about a time you were faced with a challenge.. tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Staff RN ED Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The nurse recruiter called me up to schedule the interview. Half an hour before the interview she calls to reschedule for 2 weeks later and says she will send the zoom link. She never did, guess she never had intention of ever interviewing me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: New grad nurse. Got a call to interview 2 days later. Received an offer more than 3 weeks after interviewing. Total process from applying to start date was more than two months.
Interview Questions: Name a time you worked with a difficult pt. How do handle conflict? When did you go above and beyond for a pt

title: RN Med Surg Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview is a recording. I was asked why choose NYP and to describe a moment I went above and beyond for a patient. The next two questions were regarding days of availability to go onto the next interview process which is with the talent acquisition specialist.
Interview Questions:
Why choose Nyp 
Describe a moment you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Emergency Medicine Physician Assistant Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview day lasted from about 9 am to 2 pm. There was a lot of waiting around while other candidates were being interviewed, but during that free time, we had the opportunity to chat with current residents. In total there were 3 different interviews - all were very friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: Looking back on your life what is something that you regret?

title: ICU Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was nervous the beginning of the interview but as time go on feel comfortable, it was telephone interview and it was good and the interview process was professional everything was good.
Interview Questions: tell me  about your self

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was via zoom and was smooth, easy, with no confusion.  Was broken up into two portions for a total of 60 minutes. First 30 minutes was spent with talent acquisition. Second session I was interviewed by the nurses and charge nurse of the unit.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
Can you name a time when you had conflict in the workplace?
What are your strengths?
Why nursing?

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview with recruiter to simply learn more about you. The interview was very easy, maybe about 15 minutes - general questions like introduce yourself, what's a challenge you faced, etc.
Interview Questions: What's a challenge that you faced?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Was hired on the spot. The hiring manager was very impressed with my resume and didn’t ask many questions besides asking me to talk about my previous work experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a very proffesional, but a comfortable interview. You definitely have to be prepared and know your interests and what do you have to offer to the company.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, spoke to HR then spoke to the manager all in same day. Presented in front of the hiring commitee who then decided if they wanted to give me the job or not.
Interview Questions: Mainly lots of questions about patient care and team work

title: CN1 Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I was asked general interview questions such as what do I like and dislike about my current position why am I interested in the position I am interviewing for and some other questions focused telehealth medicine.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Occupational Therapy Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was pretty standard. they outlined the job requirements and schedule. They then asked about my clinical experiences, challenges regarding those experiences, and then specifics to my experiences. They wnated to know why I wanted to work there etc.
Interview Questions: They asked about strengths and weaknesses

title: Patient Transport Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews one was virtually where they have questions and I recorded my answers and was told I made it to the next steps which was the second interview with the department manager virtually as well.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses ?
Describe a time where you where faced with a challenge?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview went smooth. they did ask on the spot question such as what what I do if a patient had an emergency? Overall it was welcoming and informative especially what they expect of you.
Interview Questions:
If I had any questions for them?
Why did I choose nursing?

title: New Grad ER Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I appreciate how  HR called me 10 mins before the interview to make sure that I am ready for the virtual interview.  I got interviewed by the director of nursing who asked me questions about my experience in research and in skilled nursing facilities.  She gave me an overview of the ER at NYP and gave me a positive outcome of my interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the ER?

title: Resgistered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through their careers section and was called by a recruiter later that day. Virtual interview scheduled for the following Monday online through ZOOM. References requested later that same day and a job offer was received 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions:
Describe a situation that you went above and beyond. 
What would your team members say your biggest strengths are? 
Tell me about yourself and why you want this job. 
Describe a scenario when things weren't going well and explain how you managed it.

title: Dietetic Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't too hard, they focused on questions that show your character and what you can bring forth when it comes to responsibility and communication. Those who interviewed with me were very easygoing and open to answering all questions at the end.
Interview Questions: They asked about how I worked within a team of diverse individuals.

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Brooklyn, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth process via zoom with quick response times from both recruiter and manager of unit.  Felt very welcoming and showed the good work culture of the hospital. After the interview it took a while for them to get back if you haven’t passed the boards yet
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by three individuals.
The question were in regards to what the job requirements will be. What's my experience has been in moving patience. Do you have experience in moving patience to the morge. The job requires moving patience to and from different departments.
Interview Questions: How are you working with others

title: Technical Anyalyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
I meet with the manager first, the project lead/analyst, and finally the Director.

It was a great interview process being able to speak with employees already in the position to get their honest feedback of their experience in the role.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the table to better support our team?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Mount Vernon, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from talent management requesting to meet with the surgeon.  I meet with the surgeon very pleasant interview. I was informed I was going to meet with the CNO, I had that interview which went all and about a week later offered the position.  Excited!!
Interview Questions: How would you describe the role of the nurse practitioner to a patient.

title: Emergency Department RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly fast. I applied for the the Brooklyn location. The same day, heard back from the recruiter and scheduled a brief, "get to know me interview" for a few days later. After the conversation with the recruiter, an interview was scheduled the same week via Zoom with at least four people. The interview lasted about 45mins and felt more like a conversation. A week after the interview, I was offered a position.
Interview Questions: -Tell me about your experience with your current/previous employer

title: Associate Development - Audio Visual Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I originally applied for the position on December 15, 2022 after seeing an advertisement for it on LinkedIN. The LinkedIN job posting redirected me to the Workday page for NYP & had me fill out a basic application. About 2-3 weeks later I received a phone call from an NYP recruiter who asked me a bunch of basic recruiter questions. Overall this phone call was about 20-30 minutes and it ended with her telling me that she would be forwarding all of my answers to the Audio Visual Services team at NYP & that if they liked my answers then they would get back to me in 24-48 hours to set up a Zoom interview. I received an email in less than 24 hours from the Audio Visusl Services team and then we proceeded to set up a Zoom interview for the next week. In this interview, I met with the whole team for about 30 minutes and they asked me a variety of basic interviews questions and also asked me questions pertaining to my resume. The interview ended with the Audio Visual Services team telling me that for the next 2 weeks they would be interviewing the other candidates and if they were going to move forward with me, then they would reach out. About 2-3 weeks later I received an email from the Executive Director of NYP asking to set up an interviews with me, and we set it up for the following week. I met with the Executive Director of NYP over Zoom and in this interview she asked me questions related to my resume and my previous professional experiences and educations. This interview lasted 30 minutes and she ended with telling me that the next steps would be to provide references. About 4-5 days later I received a call from the intitial recruiter who first called me back at the beginning of this whole process and she explained that it was now down to me and 1 other candidate and we both had about 5-6 days to get 5 references to fill out a confidential NYP form that would be sent to their emails. I got my references to do everything in about 2-3 days and the next week I got a final call from that same recruiter for NYP who provided me with the amazing news that I got the job. Overall, this was a very long process and it was not easy. In total it was about 6-7 weeks and now my onboarding process for the job is another 5 weeks.
Interview Questions: Speak about a time where you showed leadership. What video editing programs are you familiar with? What were some of your favorite courses in college/grad school? Do you have any questions for us?

title: Senior Sourcing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The process was a mess from the jump. One of the hiring managers actually reached out to me first - directly. Set up an initial phone screen with her. The convo was to determine whether I would fit on the clinical or non-clinical side. I thought it was a good talk, and I said that I looked forward to next steps. She mentioned hearing back from HR.

I don't know what's going on with the HR team at this place, but at no point in this process did I ever actually talk to anyone from HR. The Sourcing team jumped in to expedite the process because apparently they needed people ASAP. I don't know if HR is swamped or what, but they were non-existent.

I then moved on to a second round with another hiring manager, and that convo also went well. She moved me on to a third round with her boss - this boss would've been the person I worked for had I gotten the job. That discussion was ok - didn't enjoy that talk like the first two interviews. But I was then given a Case Study to work on. 

I worked on this Case Study, turned it in, and then proceeded to wait a month before reaching out to the hiring managers to get any sort of update. It took two tries, but the lead hiring manager finally reached out and said he would contact me by the end of the week with an update. Before the week was out, I received a rejection email from. No explanation for why it took a month for anybody to respond. No reason for why I was turned down. Didn't even bother to go over what I did right or wrong on the case study. Nothing. I found out after the fact that one of the hiring managers actually left NYP towards the end of the summer anyway - so that tells me a lot right there. 

On the surface, this seemed like an absolute mess, and I'm glad that they ended up turning me down anyway. I don't need to walk into another train wreck situation - I'm already in one now.
Interview Questions: What makes you feel that you would be a good fit at NYP?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I interview at NYPH, the process took little less than 2 months. First contacted by HR, then team meeting (few people in one call), assignment, meeting with the head of department, finally complete silence.
Their assignment is not really an assignment, it's a month deck that needs to be prepared for the c-management level. So very unfair to give it to candidates as an assignment. The worse is they will Ruch all the process for the applicants to get to the assignment part, once you submit it. They will schedule a so called interview to make you feel that you're still in the hiring process, but after that it will be complete silence. 
When applicant spent hours to prepare/work for free  for your department a financial deck for free (so call it's part of the interview process), show respect in return to give an answer does not matter positive or negative to their application. One email response won't cost you 3minutes.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions over all during the interview?

title: Trauma Outreach Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process seemed to be disorganized. I was contacted  initially by the Trauma Coordinator who claimed she had received my resume from the recruiter, however, I was never contacted by anyone from talent  acquisition.  Several days later I received an email from talent acquisition,  requesting an interview. Historically talent acquisition is the first contact an applicant  has 
with a potential employer. At the conclusion of the interview with talent acquistion, I was informed that I would receive follow up regarding the postion with in a week "either way", which I interpreted as someoe would communicate with me regarding the postitionwhether and offer would be made or not.Unfortunately I was not
 informed within stated time period.  I was not offered the above position  but think it would be helpful if the rejection email contain some personal elements as to why the institution did not find you to be an appropriate candidate.
Interview Questions: What inspired me to enter nursing?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the position through the careers website and 4 days later, I was contacted by a recruiter through email for an interview invitation. They requested my availability in the next couple weeks after. I had my interview 1 week after I received the email, so it was more than enough time to prepare. They scheduled me for two interviews in one day, the first with a recruiter by phone and the second with the Patient Care director of the unit through zoom. The interview with the recruiter felt more intense since she asked more scenario questions, but nonetheless, it went really well. Be aware that not everyone's energy will be what you expect so don't let their mood affect your enthusiasm for the position. As for the interview with the PCD, there were 2 charge nurses on the Zoom video call as well and it felt very casual and more like a conversation. Afterwards, I was asked to come into the hospital for a tour of the unit and to meet the team. This took about 30-40 minutes. In the end, I had a final interview with the PCD and the Nurse unit manager, which also felt very casual. They do a wonderful job of making you feel comfortable and getting to know you. In total, the interviews for the day lasted about 3-3.5 hours. I had a good feeling about getting an offer because an hour after the interview, they requested references and completion of the "Getting to know you" assessment. About a week later, I received a verbal offer and then an official offer letter.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflicts?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied on their website on a Monday got a response back on Friday. Interview was the following week Thursday on the phone with HR. Lasted about 30 min. The second part was an hour later with the Patient Care Director of the Unit. That interview lasted about 45 min through an app called Webex Meetings (Face to Face Video Interview) due to social distancing. It all went very well.
Interview Questions:
HR asked me basic and situational questions. I also had a lot of questions as well. She also informed me of benefits and salary.

The Patient Care  Director asked me situational and behavioral questions, nothing I’m not use to answering just basic. She also told me the position hours, scrub color for the unit, very helpful information on the unit and staff. I also had questions. The specific unit is very challenging so she also asked if I could handle it. I have many years of Trauma experience and I am always up for a challenge and said absolutely.

The following day HR called me to see if I had any questions and told me the interview went well. She gave me a rate for the position but because I have over 10 years experience I told her what I was comfortable with. At that point she said she would contact the director with the rate I wanted and get back to me. In the meantime, they were moving forward with me. She emailed me a link for 5 references 2 had to come from 2 Managers/Supervisors from 2 different companies. The other 3 can be your coworkers. All my references responded over the weekend. On Monday by 4p HR called to offer me the position along with the rate I was comfortable with. 

I start training on my unit in 3 weeks and must pass a background check, drug test and physical within that time. 

This was the fastest response for this hospital. It can sometimes take months to get a response back. 

Overall, everything went well and they were extremely pleasant. 

It’s an honor to work for NYP and I cannot wait to be a part of an Awesome place!

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions:

Talked with the recruiter and was told the chief PA would like to interview me and that in the next 2 weeks someone would reach out to schedule it. Nobody did, so I contacted again and then the interview was immediately scheduled. The interview was pleasant, around a one hour conversation with some scenario questions. About two weeks later I hear that they would like to move on to the next step and requested my references. My 5 references respond within around 2 days; however, after that, the recruiter completely ghosted me. Called the recruiter 2 times, sent maybe 2 emails within the span of a month, no reply.

Two other positions within the NYP health system still interviewed me during this wait time, but once they realized I was in the reference phase for another position under NYP they no longer considered me for the other positions. 

Very confusing experience and super unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: MBA Summer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
- Applied online.
- Received first round interview via phone call.
- Got second round offer; went to NYC headquarters for two 20-minute interviews with each department of interest.

- Reasons for my negative overall experience rating: 
My first interview went well, and the individuals were interested, professional, and reasonable. My second interview with the IT department was frustrating and disappointing. The interviewer made multiple sexist remarks about women (stereotyping and condescending). He seemed like he meant well and was perfectly nice, but he was oblivious that what he was saying was outdated and offensive. Furthermore, he spent most of the time thinking aloud and gave barely any time for me to ask or answer questions. I was disappointed in NYP's selection of this interview representation, and it was difficult to look past.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions; my reason for interest, previous projects, etc.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Brooklyn, NY)

A classmate of mine got the job and didn’t even answer the question. It’s all about favoritism and if you they don’t like you they will not hire you. The communication after the interview process is nonexistent if you didn’t get the job. No answers to emails or voicemails.  It’s very frustrating when someone that used to hide from doing work gets the job over you, and you have to walk around for 2-3 months with no feedback. There are honest workers that really want to work and care about nursing but to get not even a reply is unprofessional. BMH needs to be more diverse.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to several RN positions through the NYP career page. It took 1 week for an HR recruiter to contact me. 1 week later - I met with HR first, and it was a pleasant experience. The interview was more of a conversation - very typical interview question. If you have experience in nursing, use those scenarios to answer each question. (That same day), I met with the PCD, and the PCD explained how the unit runs (# of beds, # of nurses/techs, ratios, skills needed on the floor), had similar interview questions + asked why this department specifically. Then I spoke to 2 nurses (again conversation-like) about the floor runs, what to expect, pros/cons of the unit. Lastly, I took a tour of the floor. The PCD said I would hear back by the end of January

Overall I had a wonderful experience speaking to HR, the PCD, the nurses about NYP + that specific department. All were pleasant, respectful, proud of their organization. 1.5 weeks after the interview, HR contacted me. Unfortunately, the department did an internal hire - but the HR recruiter is setting up another interview for me with a PCD on a different unit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? How did you get into nursing? Why NYP (#1 in NY state, #5 nationally + top 5 in 6 specialities)? Why this department? Name a time you had to deal with a difficult coworker? Are you part of any projects or organizations at work? How do you handle stress at work? Name a time you advocated for your patient.

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process took almost a month. I had a 30 min phone interview and then an hour in person interview. After that they started the onboarding process by asking for my references. A few days later I get a random email telling me I have another interview with the director. I wasn't informed of this, no-one asked me if the time and date was ok, they just randomly sent me this email expecting me to take. Which I did. I asked the recruiter if I should stop reaching out to my references because of this random interview , he told me no. Now I guess the director doesn't trust her teams opinion enough. She started interviewing me like I hadn't spent nearly 2 hours already interviewing with the hospital. There was pages of notes on me.  Talking to her was more like "how can you earn my respect" instead of can you do the position. She asked the same questions over and over again expecting a different answer each time. Seem like a real power trip. I emailed about my status since it been over 3 weeks. Got no response, until over a week later at 8pm. How unprofessional. This place seems like the culture is toxic and not a good one to join.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Sept 2019

It started with 2 phone interviews which had the typical interview questions. One phone interview was scheduled on the same day as the on-site interview which didn't seem very organized from their end as I would need to wait for the phone call before being able to leave for the on-site interview.

I arrived early to the interview, but the nurse manager was late half an hour. Another nurse on the floor came to talk to keep me company and it seemed it was going great. Once the nurse manager came by, she just dominated the conversation and I wasn't asked any questions at all. I had to ask whether or not they had questions for me regarding my qualifications for the position to be asked 2 clinical scenario questions and that was it. title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was very smooth and warm! The talent acquisition specialist who interviewed me was so kind and friendly and she slide her interview questions in so smoothly that it felt more like an easy going conversation about values and experiences. The patient care director who interviewed me was also kind and warm and made me feel very comfortable through out the whole process, offered me tons of information about the unit he felt I might what to know and answered any questions I had.  

Here is my advice both from my own experience and an NYP career building seminar I went to: - Research your interviewer and their career path ahead of time and also find out anything you can about the culture and initiatives of the unit ahead of time to impress your interviewer (ex through asking around I already knew about a quality control measure on the unit that was going on, and through the unit twitter feed I knew about some other exciting things they had going on). 
- NYP uses "behavioral interviewing," based on the idea that past behavior can predict future performance so prepare your interview answers using the STAR format: situation/task, action, result. Remain concise and on topic!  
- Don't forget to write down your questions so you won't forget them! I actually printed out a special copy of my resume with my questions and a one line bullet point for a lot of my prepared answers printed on the back so in case i drew a blank i could take a peak, but in the end the process of writing it down helped me to remember anyway so I didn't even have to refer to it. 
-Be aware of your body language 
- Email a thank you note to all of your interviewers! Try to include something you talked about or learned during the interview to personalize it, ex "it really resonated w me that we discussed.." 

Above all, go in with a can do attitude and your best professional look and be yourself! Good luck!
Interview Questions: Why Nursing

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The overall experience of interviewing and onboarding was a NIGHTMARE. Here's a summary to keep it short:

1. I was given an impromptu phone interview...
...It was preceded with an email asking to schedule a time, however I had not yet responded and got an unexpected call with phone interview questions a day or two later. Luckily I was generally prepared and available.

2. I was given ambiguous instructions as to where to arrive for my in-person interview and nearly blamed when I was not in the exactly correct meeting place...
...I managed to seat myself just a few feet from the correct location (next to a door I was supposed to ring a bell to enter, against the wall of the waiting area I was supposed to be seated in), but the interviewer walked right past me without checking if I was the interviewee (the only person waiting in business attire on the only bench in a narrow main lobby) and then called me a few minutes after the scheduled time to imply "you're not here." She then admitted as we walked to the interview room that she "thought it was me" yet hadn't said anything.

3. I was given a pharmacology exam and provided no study materials/suggestions for content and vague instructions to find the testing location...
... the location was in a service building with no official entrance and locked doors that required a company ID to enter (which I had no yet received).

4. The background check instructions and links were never sent to me...
... I was called and provided verbal instructions as to what I needed to do for onboarding, my point person told me "don't take notes, it will all be in the email." The email had zero instructions for a background check, then I was called a week later asking why I hadn't filled out the background check.

5. The background check itself then took such a long time that my start date had to be pushed back a month...
...There were 2 'discrepancies' on my background check and it took them over 3 WEEKS to verify the two simple discrepancies (aka make 2 phone calls). 

6. I was given instructions by one point person that unofficial transcripts were acceptable, then told after sending them via email that they were not acceptable....

7. My start date was pushed back 1 month over the phone, and I was given the WRONG DATE...
...With my original Monday start date looming on a Friday afternoon, still with ZERO information regarding an orientation meeting time/place, I was told verbally that my start date would be pushed back, then provided ZERO written confirmation. When what I thought was 1 week before my start date had arrived and I still had zero starting info, I called my point person and was told "you're supposed to be here RIGHT NOW." Turned out that I was given a week late start date, sent an email 2 business days before the actual start date.

8. I was told by my point person the night before my start date that I "had to show up this time" after being given the wrong date by that very person one month prior. 

9. I missed vital information and activities, a previously planned trip to visit family, an entire day of pay, and a day's worth of work time allotted to learning what I would need to know in my position with no guidance on how to remedy my predicament ... 
...My first day of work involved having to explain to people why I was unprepared and trying to track down things that were fundamental to my continuing to work the next day. This, all while missing a previously planned trip to visit family that cost me $400. I also had to file about 8 documents the following week due to the clocking-in/out system not recognizing me. Then I was made to attend the first day I had missed on a date I was scheduled to learn concepts I would need for doing my job and was expected to catch up on my own time.

10. I was given the WRONG location when making up an orientation day I had missed due to my point person's mistake...
Interview Questions: Why NYP?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The process took about a month and a half from the moment I applied for the job. I got an unexpected phone call/phone screening while at work and then was invited for the interview day for multiple units. The actual interview day was rather nerve racking as there are about 10 round tables with different areas of health, such as ICU/CCU, ED, Peds, Medsurg (oncology, surgical, telemetry,etc), and women and child health. 
There were a lot of RN's waiting around the tables until it was their name to be called in which we handed our resume to the coordinator and they brought us to the table to be interviewed by multiple nurse managers from various units. That was quite nerve racking as I knew the nurses who were close by my table could hear my entire interivew. 
Luckily, the nurse managers were all very kind and personable, thus making the experience a positive one.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you exceeded expectations and did not exceed expectations

title: Associate Level Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The entire hiring process took three months. I applied online independently for a skill set that matches well. Heard back from phone interview around two weeks, went well and then silence for a very long time, couldn't verify if still interested in me, quite difficult to get any reply from first-tier recruiter/coordinator. After 5 weeks I heard back from them they are still considering my candidacy and arranged an in-person interview with higher-level recruiter, hiring manager and one staff member. After this stage if the hospital is interested in you the ball will start rolling very fast. Next stage is a test, followed by reference check, followed by a written offer. After the offer, there will be thorough background check for the last seven to fifteen years depending on what type of jobs you apply for. The last two steps won't start until you accept the offer letter. Overall positive experience except the long wait without any update pre interview stage. The hiring process is very transparent and most things conducted online. Be very honest is key in all these steps.
Interview Questions: Why interested in working here? Example of relevant skills that will help you do well in this position. Tell me about yourself.

Interview Questions: Name a time i went out of my way for a patient.

title: Food and Nutrition Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was pleasant. The recruiter was awesome. She was very welcoming and we had an amazing conversation.  However, the second half was not the same.  

I met with the Manager Operations Food and Nutrition and two other managers I assume. The director was pleasant. The other two were rude and unprofessional.  Whenever I didn't understand the question or answer it wrong they snickered and laughs like middle schoolers. One was looking up at the ceiling looking around and the other looking at her watch. I can definitely feel their energy as they checked out of the interview. I felt judged and so uncomfortable.  

This honestly is a bummer.  They are about to launch new systems and programs and I want to be part of it. I am extremely passionate about hospitality. food service, and team building. I put 100% in everything I do.  I firmly believe I would be a great addition to this team. 

I still appreciate this opportunity to interview with them. I learned a lot about this industry and I will make sure to work on my skills and build on areas I am lacking on in order to be confident and transition into healthcare. Looking back, I was not fully prepared and that is on me to make sure I dot all my I’s and cross all my T’s. However, making facial expressions, laughing, and being downright disrespect during an interview is uncalled for and I did not deserve that. 

Whenever I interview people for my store, I make sure they feel comfortable and have a great experience even if I choose not to move forward with them. Why? Because they are customers or potential customers and we have to make sure they continue to be fans and support our business.  The last thing I want is to leave a bad taste in their mouth. 

I honestly do not know if they will even offer me the position. Most likely they won’t and I am content with that. To be quite honest, they probably will not even read this. But if they do, I want them to understand that they should always respect anyone they interview with. Even if you think they are a joke. You represent your company, remember that. 
 
Thank you again to Monique and Manager Operations Food and Nutrition. It was a pleasure. You guys are about to do amazing things there and can't wait to witness it. 

P.S
No, I did not write this because I did not or will not get the position. I wrote this because I honestly felt horrible and belittled after leaving the interview and no one should ever feel like that.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with underperforming team members?

title: Dietary Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had a call with the talent requiter then interviewed in person not too long after that call. Met with two supervisors out of many from the department and was left with a "we're still interviewing and once we set up a meeting with the rest of the supervisors, we'll let you know," That was about a month ago, I emailed one of the supervisors and got no response. Emailed/called the requiter and received no response either. Today, almost reaching the 2 month point, I got an email saying they've considered other candidates. Which, is fine. They just lack common courtesy. It would've been better to tell me "hey, sorry it’s taking so long! we’re in the process of interviewing others and are browsing our options. we’ll let you know asap whenever we get another update of any sorts," than no response AT ALL. Get it together! This is coming from a "professional establishment," that's truly debatable after this.
Interview Questions: Do you feel comfortable being in a work place that will have you be moving around?
