Did about an hour and a half technical interview on software design for real-world problems/solutions and then some CS related questions. Everyone was great and the projects seemed really interesting. 

I got word a few days later from the manager that he wanted to move forward. He said HR would contact me to send an offer and do all the background stuff. From this moment forward was 100% the worst experience I've ever had with an HR department and the on-boarding process at a company.  I had to consistently reach out to the recruiters to get information. I would leave voicemails and send emails but never get a response. I would also get the wrong information a lot of the times. The only way to make any progress would be to reach out to my manager and let him know the situation. He would call HR and then they would immediately call me back. If I had not already committed to working at NYP, I would have accepted an offer at a different company based purely on how terrible this entire process was. 

Once I started everything was great though! Love my team and managers, and the office is in a nice building by Grand Central.
Interview Questions: Software design from the ground up

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed  first with the talent recruiter .  After I was sent to get interviewed by the phlebotomy supervisor.  Then there was a third interview with the staff I was going to be working with .
Interview Questions: Did you ever come across an irate patient ? And if so how did you handle it ?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview. I was called late and offered no apology and a vague explanation. The person I spoke with said that her assistant would be contacting me because they wanted to set up an in-person interview.  I did not hear back for days, so I emailed the assistant and still received no response.  I then checked on my application and it said I was no longer being considered.  Wow.  I’m sure the interviewer realized something in my app she’d missed (didn’t seem like she’d read my resume at all and she had poor attention to detail) that wouldn’t make me a good candidate after we spoke or they interviewed someone with more experience, but that is just low.  Everyone experiences the, “oh yeah we’ll get back to you next week” lie, but to tell me there would absolutely be an in-person interview and then flat out ignore me? Basically ghosted by NY Presbyterian. Just want management to know how poorly their HR department treats potential candidates.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult experience at work you had and how you dealt with it.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Albuquerque, NM) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I felt very comfortable and welcomed. Everyone was friendly yet professional. Was asked 1- questions and then was asked to job shadow. I was advised of the outcome at the end of the job shadow and was allowed to ask all the queatikms I had regarding work environment and policies
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you made a mistake, and how did you fix it?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online
Recruiter reached out.
Initial phone screening from recruiter about background.
Hiring manager phone screen about resume, asked questions about architecture of big data solutions.

Now it has been 2 months. Never heard anything from them about the position. Recruiter Ghosted.
Interview Questions: Describe real time streaming analytics

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very organized and was structured in a very professional manner. They mostly ask questions that pertains to respect, innovation, teamwork, and patient safety. The process tool a little less than 2 weeks from the phone interview to the phone job offer. HR person discussed the compensation package over the phone and asked if I accept. It was the best thing ever!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to collaborate with other disciplines to help a patient. How did you handle it?

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, few weeks later got an email to schedule an interview.  First round was with the team I would be working with, couple of technical and background questions all went well and made it to the next round.  Got called back to meet more team members, overall I got the impression that I would get an offer.  However, I never received a call or email and the communication broke off after last round of interviews.  After investing time in the interview process  I would expect at least an email with the decision.
Interview Questions: Couple of technical question relating to the job, nothing beyond the scope of the job.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. They called me a month later, after that I waited for another month to get the second interview. 

The first interview was straight forward and the second interview was approximately for 35 minutes. They were very friendly in both interviews.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about NYP?
Why do you think you would be a good fit?
Why do you want to work for us?
Tell me about yourself?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Cortlandt Manor, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was good, follow up with process was lacking. It had multiple steps, a test first and once I accepted i had to follow up with questions of when to start,where to go, etc.
Interview Questions: Do you have any healthcare experience?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: This was a very long process. Almost a month to interview between the recruiter and department. Even after you're hired, the start could be up to month before you can start.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the hospital/department?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: You have to gather your facts right because the they will do a background check on all your references  so that means you cant lie on your resume. Also dress appropriately.
Interview Questions: why I chose to work in that industry

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about 2 weeks after I applied. The process took over a month. I was first interviewed by the manager. After about 2 weeks I was contacted by the HR, which seemed a little backwards. I was interviewed by HR, then informed about a week later of the offer.
Interview Questions: What qualifications do you have?

title: Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I went to the HR office first to answer questions, then I was told to go to the actual hospital and the floor supervisor that I would be working for would be waiting for me. She asked me more questions, nothing too bad. Very casual vibe, but serious questions to know you're serious about the job, the hospital, and caring for patients.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you worked as a team. Describe the experience in detail.

title: Surgical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. If you get picked up, you'll interview with the administrator or practice manager first. Then you are to interview with the doctors. Lastly, if you get selected then, interview with HR.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a stressful work enviornment?

title: Dietitian Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very Easy and Very Fast! The Interviewers were very nice. I had to go in for interview 3 times. first with Supervisor, second Manager and third the Director. Everyone was very nice and very help full.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Professional, friendly, and clear document/job requirements.
Overall great experience and the hiring process was very fast and easy. Would recommend anyone to apply as they also provide the opportunity for tuition reimbursement.
Interview Questions: Past experience,  education and goals.

title: Summer Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not very long and they got back to me within a week after the interview. The interviewer was very friendly and the questions were not too difficult.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a patient who is feeling uneasy?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: it was a long process due to the clearing the background test. First I received a phone interview the a pre-screen interview through online. I had to be knowledgeable in word, data entry and excel. Next I received a face to face interview in which was very easy going. Because ive been in this field for quite some time the questions became natural.
Interview Questions: tell me a little about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied as a new graduate nurse to the EDIN program. EDIN stands for Emergency Department Inpatient Program. It's a bridge program for new graduates who want to work in emergency nursing. The new grad will start off caring for patients who are admitted and waiting for a bed. After some time working in the EDIN unit, you can transition to the normal ED. Interview process was quick and painless. I initially interviewed with a recruiter over the phone and then she invited me to the Cornell interview event in March 2018. They only hold ED interview events once per month, so I had to wait over a month between speaking with the recruiter and attending the interview event. I met with the recruiter, two ED nurses, and the Patient Care Director in a panel-like interview. They were super nice and asked me why I want to work in the ER and some basic behavioral type questions.  Interview lasted less than an hour. I was told they'd get back to me in a week or two, but they called the next day with an offer!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to start your career in emergency nursing?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was professionally done,my interviewer was very polite,soft spoken that every word she says  was well understood also every other staff was well understandable with a lot of encouragement
Interview Questions: Why do I want to be hired as asap C N A

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: They asked a lot about the resume, so keep an eye out on that. Definitely have questions ready to ask them, shows that you're interested. Overall the interview process was okay but afterwards I didn't receive any phone call or email.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose NYP?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was an open, friendly conversation between the Nurse Manager and I. She then brought two other nurses on the floor to join in and ask me some questions. They spoke about the unit and asked me why I think I would be a good fit. Everyone at NYP was incredibly nice and accommodating. I enjoyed the interview experience and felt that I would be joining a family.
Interview Questions: Tell me some of your strengths and some of your weaknesses.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Flushing, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to the Registered Nurse interview event at Nyp/queens. 
Received a phone screen a week later and got invited to the event. 
At the event I was interviewed by 2 nurse managers from two different units. Took the pharm exam the same day. 
Exactly a week later I was called with an offer and to submit license, BLS etc. 

The process was very quick for me. I applied March 13th and received an offer on the 30th. I was confused about the process and called HR a few times and they were really polite about answering my concerns.
Interview Questions: Why nursing

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: interview with the group members; a lot of self-introductions and information from the group; talking about the going project and check about the skillset. not too technical. It takes long (~4 hours) to finish all the part. All interviews has been during the same day.
Interview Questions: based on CV; what question do you have for us

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied thru website and received an email within two weeks for a short phone interview. Later that day, after brief phone interview, l received , an email with a link for a proficiency test. That being done, within a week, I received a call inviting me to interview at the talent acquisition center. I felt the interview went well and I was very happy and excited when I was sent that very day for second interview to main building. The second interview I felt relaxed and knew I had all the experience and qualifications they were seeking as well as customer service skills required. I left feeling encouraged. I emailed my recruiter upon my exit, thanking them for the chance. Within a short time that very day, I received a link from my recruiter requesting   my references. Not a personal note, but the link. That link, requesting 5 references from at least 2 or 3 current or past supervisors from my resume work history and 2 coworkers from same history to be supplied within 24 hours. That being done, I noted that within 2 days , my references had completed the requested 30 questions and submitted all  comments. Two of my current and previous coworkers said they had a bit of a dilemma when asked for 3 areas of improvement on my part. I again emailed my recruiter, and did not get a response. That was four weeks ago, and I have not heard anything since. The sinking feeling I was not chosen has left me confused and anguished since I really have no idea if they are still considering me.
Interview Questions: My biggest or best service story.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: was intensive questions, that needed past experience to explain with examples, have to compare previous job side by side with current position in terms of customers expectation to get the director understand how I can be useful to the hospital
Interview Questions: coordination of empathy and team work

title: EDEN Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by Talent Sourcing specialist to first set up interview date and time. They only hold interviews once a month for positions into the EDEN Program for new graduate nurses. There are 25 spots available. I Meet with 4-5 staff members from the emergency department and the nursing recruiter.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you had to advocate for your patient

title: Information Technology Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: it was an absolute nightmare they request your almost entire history from work, medical and personal to comb through as they see fit. they require you to tell them if you're undergoing any treatments taking any medication and go through a psych evaluation.
Interview Questions: standard questioning but left more like an interrogation.

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The Hiring Process Was Very Easy ‘ I Applied For Security At Cornell And Was Scheduled To Come In For Their Big Security Interview Day Event But Before I Was Set To Go They Had Sent Me A Email Which Required 5 References ( ACTIVE Emails & Telephones) And Wanted Each Reference To Fill Out A Survey On My Job Skills , Etc. After My References Completed Their Survey I Was Sent Another Email Which Was Giving Me The Time I Can Choose To Come In For My Interview. I Sat With a Sergant Very Calm And Easy Question (Other Interviews Was Being Held In The Same Room I Was Placed In But It Was Still 1:1) ... After I Was Done With My Interview I Was Called Back A Week Later & Now Will Be Going In For My Orientation ..
Interview Questions: What Can You Bring To Presbyterian Hospital In Which Can Keep Us #1

title: Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great experience interviewed with three staff  members, over a period of weeks. First I had a phone interview, then two interviews in person with staffing coordinators at the hospital.
Interview Questions: Why am I choosing to work for the hospital?

title: PCD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Long process I had to provide multiple things in order to start the process. I had to also give 5 references. It made me feel comfortable to know that they looked at everything.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Graduate Summer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: We applied online, had an initial screening call, then were invited to an interview day. The interview day was great. It was awesome to meet other candidates, and everyone from Talent Acquisition was super helpful. Additionally, members from most departments were present and answered all of our questions as we mingled and waited for our interviews to begin. Once interviews began, it was like speed dating as each department was set up in one room at tables, and we switched every 20 minutes although we only interviewed with three different departments individually.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background.

title: Internal Medicine Physician/Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online at NYP careers website. I received an email from a recruiter requesting an initial phone interview with Talent recruiter ( just asked why I wanted to work at NYP and what my top 3 areas of interest are). After, I was scheduled for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? Why NYP

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Difficulty getting in touch with recruiters when it came time to schedule and rescheduling interview times. Once I did get in touch and began the process, there was a lot of traveling on my part to know how to navigate the map of the hospital on my own versus actually being escorted by a hr specialist or the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: What was a campaign you helped lead and how did you measure success?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long!  I had a total of 4 interviews.  My 1st was by a talent and acquisition coordinator, which lasted at most 5 min.  It was very low key and she asked me basic questions such as why I wanted to be a nurse and when I finished school.  Things went well and I was then scheduled to talk with the talent acquisition manager two weeks later.  This interview was more in depth and my interviewer had been a nurse for 20 years.   Things went well and so she told me she'd let me know when she could set up another interview with the Patient Care Director of the respective floor I would be working on.  My 3rd interview was scheduled almost two weeks later because of the Christmas holiday.  My 3rd interview went OK and I had a call with the talent and acquisition manager and she recommended I return and interview with a different Patient Care Director from another unit.  My 4th and final interview went great and I was hired on the spot!
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation with a patient and/or their family and how you handled.

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: This is a temp assignment. The process was easy. I interviewed with my Hiring Recruiter at Winston Staffing and within 3 days I was offered the role. Very easy process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and background

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was okay. The hiring contact (security supervisor) was very interested in my skills and past experience.  They wanted to know about my experience with incident reports,patrolling and such.  Everything was well except the pay is low and non-negotiable. They offered $18 hour and the overnight shift.  The interviewer asked me what I make in my current position which is significantly higher.  He made it clear he wanted me to leave my current position but was not willing to negotiate the rate. Once I stated that it would be unreasonable to ask that without negotiation, the interviewer was uninterested in hearing anything else I had to say. Honestly, he was quite rude after that. I think NYP is a great place to work but HR definitely needs to prep staff on how to properly interview candidates. Even if there is no match, interviewing is a form of networking and respect goes both way. Also, in NYS it is illegal to ask candidates salary history so staff needs to be prepped on those issues. Overall, the interview was okay but this is more for an entry level person in terms of the salary.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for NYP?

title: Mental Health Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (White Plains, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview is straight forward with the traditional questions that you can find on the internet. You meet with HR first and you get interviewed there and then you meet with the patient care director of the unit.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview/screening to discuss my background, and logistics in going to work if that would be an issue. I said it wouldn't be an issue so they set-up an in-person interview three weeks due to me being away from the country for vacation.
Interview Questions: Why NYP

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Cortlandt Manor, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Filled out online application. Got a call from hospital HR to set up an appointment. Interview with recruiter and then the unit manager. Had to submit five references. Received offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you made a mistake in nursing.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed first with the recruiter and then the nurse manager. Both were very nice. The nurse manager then brought in other nurses from the unit to ask me questions. Unfortunately, they went on a hiring freeze after I interviewed so the position went away.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths, weaknesses, give an example of how you worked on a team, what is your greatest accomplishment, what type of unit would you thrive in.

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty straight forward interviewing process (Thank you NYP for not having a large number of rounds). I applied online, received an email a few weeks later to set up an in person interview. Met with two interviewers who were really laid back, talked about my qualifications and the position. Then  a few hours later I got a call from HR seeking to set up an interview for later that week. I met with HR and was offered the position a few days later, which I accepted.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you had to deal with a difficult situation and how did you resolve?

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the manager and director of the specific department. They were both welcoming and friendly. They called me back a few days later stating that they wanted to set me up with an interview with HR. I know usually is the other way around where you met with HR first then the department. However HR has yet to get back to me. I understand they are busy but it is very unprofessional and not fair on the candidate side. I know most hospitals do this protocol but again is not fair that HR has all the saying, especially when you are not even going to work with them. Why do you even have to interview with them if you already interviewed with the department and they want to hire you. It’s horrible the way the system works. I’m tired of people relying on HR for everything, when 9/10 times once hired you’ll never see or speak to HR again.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult patient?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied via NYP carrier website and was contact shortly thereafter. Was asked about my availability for interview. Was emailed the next day with a phone interview and a face to face interview schedule.
Interview Questions: Reason for previous separation.

title: Nursing Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and within 3 days got an email back scheduling a phone interview. During the phone interview they had told me they were going to be emailing me in 2 weeks to schedule a face to face interview. I then scheduled it for a week later and I went into a waiting room with a bunch of people. We waited to be called by one of the 5 people interviewing. Then two weeks later I received my offer letter.
Interview Questions: What was a time you went above and beyond for a patient?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a summer volunteer position in March. I got invited to interview about 2-3 weeks later. After the interview, I got an offer about 1 week later. You then have a month to complete the necessary paperwork and medical examination (which includes a urine drug test).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer here? Tell me about your past volunteer experiences?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position on August 20th. Totally forgot about applying as I applied for jobs everyday and was currently employed. They called me on October 13th to set up an interview. I interviewed with a Talent Recruiter, then the Patient Care Manager. I was told they'd reach out to me in two weeks. One week later I got another call to come in and meet the Clinical Manger. That went well, she said it'd be another two weeks. In exactly two weeks, I was called and offered the position!!!
Interview Questions: Name a time you dealt with a difficult patient and how you handled them.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
talent acquisition /HR contacted me for a phone interview. It was brief and questions were about my background and work history. 
Then, I was scheduled for a in person interview in 2 weeks with Director of the department and patient care director.
Interview Questions: Why NYP?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interview. They asked some questions about real life situations from the past or potential situations. You are expected to give an example and discuss how you handled  or would handle that situation. Pretty straight forward.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation with a difficult patient, and how you handled it.

title: Emergency Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received phone call a week later. Easy simple interview questions regarding resume. Interviewer asked questions about job experience and educational background.  Formal at first, then asked personal questions. I received an offer the week after the interview in person.
Interview Questions: What makes you a fit for this position?

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied back in July, initial phone call with one of the managers occurred three weeks after.  A very quick conversation followed by a promise to get an interview scheduled before the end of month.  As it was the end of the month and I still didn’t hear back, I reached out to HR.  HR interview occurred over the phone at this time and the HR rep seemed curt and unfriendly over the phone.  Another month later, an in person interview was scheduled but only after I told them I had another offer.  The in person interview seemed quick and hurried as they knew I might’ve been slightly overqualified for the role.  However, I was still very much interested.  The interview seemed very informational and more of a get to know you type deal not an interview in which they showed serious interest in my background.  I waited a couple weeks and found out they were passing on my candidacy not by phone call or even an email, but by logging into their careers website.  Very impersonal.  Needless to say I won’t be seeking a position with them again, after trying many, many times.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received email to set up an interview shortly after. Met with both HR and unit manager on one day. Both HR and manager were very nice; easy to talk to, made you feel comfortable. Asked basic nursing scenario questions. Applied and interviewed within two weeks, although didn't hear back with response for several weeks later.
Interview Questions: How would your co-workers describe you?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online, emailed my application to the provided email, and actually received an email the very next day asking me when I was available to interview. Needless to say, I was very surprised (and extremely pleased and happy) because I thought I would have to wait longer.
The interview was a bit peculiar. I walked into the office and was immediately given a sheet with typical interview questions on it and was asked to fill it out. Then, I gave the sheet to the interviewer who asked me additional and follow-up questions. I was then given paperwork, including medical records, and am due back for a medical screening very soon.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer at our hospital?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Received an email from a talent acquisition specialist about a week after applying. Scheduled a short telephone interview with her. I then scheduled an in person interview with a nurse recruiter and the unit manager which took place two weeks after the phone interview. title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital

And I then received an auto-generated email that I do not meet the preferred qualifications. I'm a Master's student who applied to several roles, including those that only require a BS degree, so I do not quite understand why the status gets updated to "Do not Meet Qualifications" immediately upon submission. I couldn't find a way to contact HR from the career website, so I'm posting this issue as an interview review. But if any Talent Acquisition employee sees this post, please leave a comment on what could have been the issue here. For your information, I'm an international student on OPT who would eventually need the employer to sponsor the visa. (I was wondering if NYP doesn't hire international applicants)
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The interview took about an hour and forty-five minutes; I interviewed with the director of the program, the program manager, the one Research Data Specialist they had on staff and their research manager. The interview with the director was pretty short, I would say about 15 minutes. He has very nice and described his role, the program and how I would contribute to the program very well. He did not give me  much of an opportunity to communicate what my skills were and how I believe I was the right fit for the job, but I was able to do so with the other three people I later interviewed with. The interviews with the other three were about 30 minutes each and they all commented on my resume and my previous experiences and asked questions related to how my past experiences would contribute to the position. I felt like I communicated well and even though the interview was an hour and forty-five minutes long, I felt like it flew by and I left the interview in an optimistic mood. 

I, however, never heard back from them. I found out that I did not get the job through an automated e-mail on a Friday night, about three weeks after the interview. The e-mail itself didn't even specify as to whether or not I got the job, all it said was thank you for applying to the position and if you want to apply to other positions, here's the link. No "unfortunately you were not selected" or anything to that affect, I had to log in to the website and when I saw "no longer considered for the position" next to the position's title, that's when I put two and two together. To be honest I was upset because I felt like the interview went so well. I had hoped that I would at least receive a more personal e-mail from anyone from that I interviewed with letting me know that I didn't get the job, but instead I got that auto-generated NYP e-mail late Friday night. Safe to say it ruined my Friday night.
Interview Questions: How would you take advantage of this position?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed for the Pharmacy Intern position years back. I believe it was back in 2012. I applied through my university's job bank and received a phone call to schedule an interview. During the phone call they asked me why I chose pharmacy, my GPA, and brief general questions about me. I then had an interview with the HR staff. I remember it was a young white male that had interview me. The front HR secretary was a young asian lady that took a copy of my intern license. 

During the interview process, the HR guy was friendly, but he was literally just asking me questions that were pre-written from a gathered list. I honestly thought the questions he asked me were not relevant to my field nor the position I was applying for. I remember he would ask me a management question, when I was applying for a pharmacy intern position. He was reading off the list and told me I was allowed to skip/not answer one question. In my opinion, it was a waste of time interviewing with him because he knows nothing about the pharmacy profession. He asked me questions that were geared for other positions and I remember he was trying to choose which questions to read off and ask me. 

Thus, in spite of the fact that he was friendly, I knew he didn't have a clue about my profession. I don't know about how much the interview process has changed. However, I do know that I would never want to work for NYP. I work as a pharmacist now and at Montefiore the interview process is much better. I was called directly by the pharmacy director and then had an interview with her and the panel of pharmacy managers. They are directly related to my field and know which questions to ask and understand the profession well. 

I believe NYP should have better HR staff that know more about the position people are applying for. Also, I think NYP is very much all about GPA's and value higher GPA's in candidates. I know of several people that work at NYP and I can't say that it is a good environment to work for.
Interview Questions: Management questions. Tell me about a time when you had to go against company's policies. What did you do and what was the result?

title: Laboratory Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for a position with this company on August 18th. I don't hear a peep from them until they randomly called me on November 4th for an initial interview. When I picked up the phone I thought it was just one of my parents doctor's calling to confirm an appointment. To my surprise it was a phone screening for this position. I was shocked. It had been so long I didn't even remember applying for the position. I even went so far as to ask the interviewer what position it was I had applied for. I wasn't prepared. I was nervous. I should have asked the interviewer to call back at another time so I could prepare. But because I was nervous I went through with it. Our conversation lasted a whopping 6 minutes. I get an email a couple days later which said they were going in another direction. 

Now, if I had went into the interview prepared and still not received the position I wouldn't be upset. I would have done my best and came up short. But I know I wasn't prepared. I know I didn't give my best. And its super frustrating that I lost out on a full time job that I was more than qualified for because I blew a 5 minute interview. I am so upset and frustrated about the whole situation. I don't think I will ever apply to work for this company ever again. I don't think I received a fair shake.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions before we start?

Met with Recruiters, was scheduled to meet the VP however he went MIA.  Apparently I was over qualified and they asked if I would apply for another Senior role.  I said ok - but then never heard back from the recruiters.  Not even a rejection letter.  Please close out your recruiting process, makes a difference and impact on the candidate experience (assuming that matters to the organization).
Interview Questions: Tell me about your last position? What is it about this position that attracted you to apply?  Walk me through your resume and provide details of your recruiting experience.  Typical HR interview, not very progressive and doesn't really engage the candidate.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, you will be interviewed by Talent Acquisition. Here, they ask you the most basic interview questions you could imagine. Secondly, you will be interviewed by your unit's PCD (Patient Care Director). In my case, I was also interviewed by a Clinical Manager, followed by several on the nurses that were on that day. Here, I was asked unit-specific questions that were more medically oriented. Then, I was taken for a tour of the unit. I heard back from talent acquisition a few hours later on the same day. Talent Acquisition is extremely organized.
Interview Questions:
Talent acquisition asked questions such as "Give a specific example of a time when...." and "What would you do in BLANK situation?" type of questions-- your basic interview. Would recommend the Johns Hopkins guide to interview questions (Google it) if you're a new RN.

The PCD asked questions such as the nurse/patient ratio of my previous unit. She asked what committees I was involved in on my previous unit (they are big on committees at NYP). She asked to give specific examples of times on my old unit where I made a big difference in a patient's care. She then asked if I was "OK" with working nights--the obvious answer to this is YES, as we all must start on nights at some point!

title: Physician Assistant Interview

The recruiter explained to me all of the benefits offered at NYP and also asked me some personal questions (like do you plan on furthering your education?) and case scenarios and to reflect on situations I experienced on rotations. Then I was sent to the Site Director's office, where I was GRILLED to the max, in regards to my rotation experience, it was very nerve wrecking. Lastly, I met with the Senior PA of the department and received a tour of the facility and spoke with a few practicing PAs.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to counsel a difficult patient and/or family member?

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview

title: Staff Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Attended New Grad interview event Jan 20. Met with 2 PCD and one HR person that day. After being persistent and staying on top of them, I got  Called in 4 months later for an interview with talent acquisition and unit manager. After meeting with HR
I met with manager on her unit. I was introduced to the staff and given a tour of the unit.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is very long for new grads. I applied to the meet and greet of Jan 2016 in November of 2015. Everyone found out whether or not they were accepted to the meet and greet in late December.  At the meet and greet you interview with three nurse managers or two managers and a recruiter.  Then there is another chop, and you find out whether or not you will be selected in the future. If you will be selected in the future, there is an individual waiting period for another interview. My next interview was scheduled for late February. I interviewed with the manager then I spent about 30 mins just hanging out with the clinical team on the unit. If the manager does not like you initially in the interview process she or he will most-likely not let you meet the other staff on the unit. The nurses and techs on the unit will ask you questions  to get to know you, your behaviors, your temperance, and how you will fit in on the team. I fit in very well with the unit, I was so relaxed. The entire interview felt like a simple discussion as opposed to an actual interview.   I heard back three days later. 

It is very easy to become discouraged in the long tedious process of applying to NYP. It's a great hospital so I think it will be worth the wait, but there is no guarantee that you will be offered a position.  I declined two new grad offers at other hospitals in the process of waiting. There was a point where I beat myself up about turning down those offers because I thought I probably would not end up with a position at NYP but it happened.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in NYP?
How do you handle stress in the clinical setting?
Where do you see yourself five years down the road?

title: Clinical Nutritionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process was quite long. From the time I applied online until I got an actual interview was about 2.5 months. 

I first applied through Indeed.com, then received email notification to take a career battery test for clinical professionals. I assumed I passed because a week or so later I got an email from HR for a phone screen. 

I didn't hear back so I applied for another opening at another location. Same HR recruiter contacted me and asked me which job I preferred. Slightly puzzled, I said I thought I was not being considered or the position was already filled. When she realized no one contacted me about the previous job she apologized and she must have contacted someone about it because the next day I got a call from another HR recruiter about a phone interview. 

The phone interview was about thirty minutes long. Then the HR recruiter was supposed to contact me in a week but she didn't. I had to email her to get her to move things along. Finally 2 more days later the clinical nutrition supervisor contacted me about a phone screen. After that, a couple days later she emailed me and said her and the hiring team are interested to bring me in for an interview. 

The actual interview took only about thirty minutes. There were about 5 dietitians in this HR hiring team. They asked questions based off of my resume and did not seem to have prepared a set of questions to ask me. Most questions were related to my daily responsibilities. They asked whether I am familiar with tube feedings and TPN. Also asked to see a portfolio. Truthfully I thought they did not seem as interested as I thought they would be. I did not think it was hard; you just have to be prepared to discuss your work experience in details. 

Then a week later the clinical supervisor contacted me to say they decided to not go further with the process because they want a candidate with experience, flexibility and who demonstrates leadership characteristics. Also someone who is proactive. 

I was fairly disappointed. The listed posting asked for 6 months of experience. I have close to 2 years of work experience and a Master's Degree. Also mentioned I should go for more certifications but I felt that was not fair because I have only became an RD for only 2 years and just recently finished my Master's. 

I wish they were more specific with what qualifications they are looking for on their job postings. HR also needed a push here and there to get things move along but I guess this is how HR processes are with big hospitals.
Interview Questions:
HR phone interview: Describe a situation where you went out of your way to help a patient.

In-person interview:
Why are you interested in applying to our hospital?
Tell us more about your job duties. 
What type of projects do you do at your hospital? 
Are you trained in physical assessment in identifying patients with malnutrition? 
Are you familiar with tube feedings and TPN?
Do you have a portfolio?

title: Volunteer Interview

Interview Descriptions: Application process took a very long time. After speaking to different people who promised they'd get back to me, I finally got through and was scheduled for an interview. It ended up being a group interview because they had a large volume of applications and it wasn't feasible to do their regular one-on-one. We were asked to partner up, ask each other questions, then tell the group/hiring manager about our partner, and he asks your partner to elaborate more on their answers.

title: Director of Security Interview

Met with many people including future subordinates.  Long process and made it to the final round but unfortunately didn't receive the job.
Interview Questions: Many scenario questions based on how you would interact with employees.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was scheduled by phone at a time that was convenient for them. The interviewers (there were two) spent the first part of the interview picking at my resume. I took that in stride, because I saw it as free-of-charge feedback, and who doesn't want that? They spent the rest of it asking questions with a tone that suggested that I really should beg for inclusion at this "number one" institution (they made sure to throw that in a few times, too).  I am entry-level for the job I interviewed for, but I am NOT entry level professionally. I expected to have to explain my transition, but....goodness. I'm sorry I felt the need to go in a different direction people!
I asked questions at the end about the interviewers (because I had looked them up prior) to see how they got where they had gotten and where they saw the position and the specific field going. I was not impressed with their answers. They stated that the next step would be to come in person, but they didn't say whether it would be a one on one plan, or a panel. I didn't ask.
I got off the phone with mixed feelings and a feeling this wasn't going to work out, though I was still a little optimistic. To be honest, I felt a little disrespected and picked apart. To add insult to injury, it took them ONE MONTH to publicly state (because I am sure they decided quickly) that I didn't get the job, and then they didn't even have the courtesy to send a direct "thanks but no thanks" email (and yes, I think those are good, because SOMEONE sent that). Rather, I had to make it a point to login to my account and see what the updated status was -- THAT is how I confirmed I was out (I mentioned the one month, correct?). I had applied for a different position way after interviewing for this one -- I applied for this new one in April --  and miraculously, they knew just a few days afterwards that they didn't want me for that either. That's fine. I don't expect to get every job I apply for. I just expected far more...everything from NYP. No.  I'm not at all impressed with this "number one" hospital, and how I was treated. I think I'll go be "number one" elsewhere.
Interview Questions: N/A
