Interview Questions: What was a time you saw a problem on your unit and how did you fix it?

title: ICU Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted within 3 days of submitting my application . Met with recruiter and then 2 days later met with dept director. Was offered the job the next day. Had to wait 6 weeks for the next orientation to begin.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working with difficult coworkers

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: So far the recruiters have been extremely helpful in contacting and communicating. We've had to reschedule a couple of times, but both they and I have been on top of it. They seem to be an extremely responsible staff.
Interview Questions: How would you react to a crisis situation?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, and was emailed almost 2 months later with boilerplate language from a no-reply email to set up phone interview. The phone screen took about 5 minutes, during which the recruiter, who knew nothing about the position, asked me two questions about my current job (which was not related particularly to the position I was applying for, despite other relevant experience listed on my CV) and then asked for a salary requirement, without offering any information about the position or opportunities to ask any questions.
Interview Questions: None were difficult, but the screen itself seemed to exist only to weed out people based on salary needs.

title: New Grad Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Meet and Greet Event. You meet with nurse recruiters. There's about 4-5 people for each nurse recruiter. When I interviewed there were 800 applicants. They asked one question which was why nursing.
Interview Questions: Why Nursing?

title: Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Expect to wait a long time between stages of the process- be patient and persistent. First you interview with a recruiter, who asks scenario-based questions, as in, "tell me about a time when... what did you do?" If you "pass" pass this stage, you interview with the departmental director. This interview is more traditional, "tell me a bit about yourself," and "how would you describe your leadership style?" If you "pass" this stage, you come in for long day of interviews. Expect to be interviewed by staff nurses, other clinical managers, patient care directors, medical directors, VPs of nursing, and staffing coordinators. These interviews vary based on the interviewer. Then expect to wait. For a while. If you've made it though the process this far, you will eventually get a call with the decision, either way.
Interview Questions: Expect to give examples of how you would resolve clinical leadership problems- not just in the moment, but taking action to prevent problems from recurring.

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I applied online around October & received email to request a phone interview. the questions were easy like why u wanna be part of our team? why NYP? a couple days days later they requested to take online basically math/ reading test. 2 weeks later  i had interview with 2 managers, basic interview questions such as tell me about yoursel, how u heard about us. Describe a bad situation with a customer or co worker involved.
Interview Questions: tell me step by step a report involving a use of force.

title: New Grad Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Took roughly six months with group interview, and individual interviews.Just be prepared to pitch yourself and alll the accomplishments you have made in your life. They want to see how passionate  you are about the nursing profession. They are also very interested in knowing why you want a specific department and why you want NYP out of the many different hospital choices. I would recommend going on the page and reading the mission statement and values of the hospital so you can incorporate that into your responses. If it looks like you did your research on the hospital beforehand, it will probably give you some leverage.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Operations Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Email from HR... 5 minute phone interview with recruiter... Waited almost a month to hear back from hiring department for an in person interview.  I had a panel interview which I was not advised of... 3 weeks later was emailed stating I was one of the candidates still in the running and needed to have another interview.  After the last interview 2 1/2 weeks later was offered the position.
Interview Questions: What was the best mistake you ever made and why?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: You will be asked to participate in 3 behavioral interviews with a Manager, Director and VP.  You should know your resume inside out and be prepared to answer situation questions as well as skills questions.  Know how to read a balance sheet and and provide basic insight based on the trends you see.
Interview Questions: How would you approach an acquisition?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Brooklyn, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The Interview process is as followed:
1.  Took a microsoft test
2.  Met with HR who asked behavioral questions.
3.  Met with Administrative team, asked various questions (yes/no).
4.  Met with Hiring Manager.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Desktop Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Talent acquisition department reached out at first and arranged an in-person interview after a brief phone interview. Met with my would-be boss and the department head, who jointly conducted the interview. It took only a few minutes and was less than formal. Relaxed feel and simple questions.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself fitting into this department?

title: Postgraduate Medical Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and non-stressful. Interview day included breakfast, meet and greet with program director and current residents and a one on one interview with a chief resident and the program director.
Interview Questions: What are your interests?

title: Truck Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was done In 2 parts. The first was through talent acquisition which was all paper work and a series of questions about experience and interests in the position. The second part was an interview with the department supervisor. Again I was asked a series of questions about my experience and interests. After answering the questions He then followed up by explaining the job description, requirements, duties and importance of the position to see if I was still interested.
Interview Questions: How long have I been operating a commercial motor vehicle

title: Recruiter - Talent Acquisition Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I received minimal information over the phone; I asked a lot of questions, but the person I spoke with told me that the recruiter would answer them in my interview. I thought it was strange that someone would call me about a job, but then not be able to tell me anything more than what I had already learned from the posting.
Interview Questions: They asked me questions about several of their problems: overworked recruiters, too many open jobs...I got the feeling that their turnover is based on the fact that most people there are overworked.

title: Junior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview took about an hour, 2 rounds of interviews, so around 30 mins for each interviewer. Both interviewers were from accounting department. The interview was about introduce yourself and they explained the job duties.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the new grad meet and greet event. I was invited back three times for interviews at three different locations with different people. the process was lengthy. I applied in May and finished the last rounds of interview in Oct. in the end, I still didn't get any offers. the competition was just intense.
Interview Questions: all the questions were standard

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews; 1 test; typing test-easy going; describe how you dealt with an irate patient was the hardest question; just remain confident; i didnt even know my interview was going to be when it was held; the interview is right after the test
Interview Questions: describe how you dealt with an irate patient

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Informative, detailed, friendly and educational. Recruiter does phone time, gets a background idea of you and what you are looking for. Then if they feel you are an ideal candidate for the job, they can contact manager of unit and then schedule interview time. During interview with manager, ask you about what you are looking for in this job, what made you choose this job, etc. Also you get to to a group interview with the manager and other staff members, so it is a well- rounding interview process including other staff members of unit as well.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to this unit?

title: Statistical Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR via phone and given an impromptu phone interview after hours. This was a slight surprise and I was caught off guard, but I must have passed the screening because I was invited for an in person interview. I met with HR and with two members of the department. The questions were fair and straightforward and I felt as though I connected with the department members and we had a lot in common and much to discuss. They must have not felt the same way. They said the interview process would take them two to three weeks, but it was nearly two months before I heard back and was not offered the position.
Interview Questions: What sorts of initiatives have you taken recently at work?

title: Food and Nutrition Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview consisted of the following questions: Why do you want to work for NYP?, Why did you leave or want to leave your employment?, Describe your previous work experience
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview with talent acquisition and then with senior management. Various questions about previous experiences and how they related to certain circumstances. Between the two interviews, I had to give examples of at least five different patient encounters I've had in the past and how each one related to my interview question.
Interview Questions: What are three traits that describe yourself?

title: New Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a group interview with 4-7 other people at your table. The second part of the process was an online battery test. The third part of the process was an interview with individual managers of floors willing to hire new grads. Even if you make it last the last step it doesn't guarantee you a job upon completion.
Interview Questions: Why did you become a nurse?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I attended the May 2014 New Grad Meet and Greet. The Talent Acquisition Team is very welcoming and enthusiastic about hiring new nursing graduates. Application is competitive (internal hires and those with experience as PCAs are strong candidates, at least superficially), but they take the time to hear everyone deliver their "living cover letter" elevator pitch.
Interview Questions: It's basically just the standard elevator pitch.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview with the hiring manager was very pleasant.  Most questions were as expected. However, the interview with HR was kind of odd. The interviewer kept interrupting and she was bouncing all over the place with her questions.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions. Many behavioral based questions.

title: Nurses Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was a former employee and decided to return. I applied online. In a few days, I received an email to schedule a phone interview. Then, I was emailed again to take an assessment test. After successfully completing the exam, I was called to schedule an interview, asked to fill out a full NYP application, and they asked for location preferences.  I went on three  interviews in two different locations, one with a 1:1 interview, and the other location, with a 1:1 interview as well with an additional interview panel of four.  Soon I received a call from a Talent Aquisition Specialist notifying me I have been hired at both locations, as I chose one.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions. Personality and scenario questions are asked where you will have to give examples to support your answers. Topics such as problems with a coworker? Visitors? What would you do if...? How would you handle certain situations. Questions are asked based on your previous work experiences as an NA.

title: OR Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was horrible. The questions asked you would think you are going to be employed with FBI. Every interview is different these questions are asked randomly from different categories. Depending on how you answer will determine if you go to the next step. YOU HAVE TO SOMETIMES CALL TO FIND OUT IF YOU GOT THE JOB! THEY ARE SO SLOW IN GETTING BACK TO YOU.
Interview Questions: Describe a time while being employed you had to tell on either your co-woker or another employee?

title: Interface Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
Took me about 6 interviews to transfer between groups at the same hospital after over 5 years of working for this hospital.
At some point, I've heard that one of the manager regretted that I didn't have a chance to be interviewed by more people. Isn't 6 interviews enough to see if a person is fit? Did anyone has to break me to a point that I just submit my whole life to the hospital?
Interview Questions: I knew I was appying to an internal position I had no experience in. I took every effort to learn what I could. There were no difficult quesitons, since it was clear I was not experienced in this field. I was asked questions that would show if I really took the effort to learn.

title: Telephone Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: One interview with HR and then another interview with the Telecommunications manager. After that you have to wait about two weeks before you know if they liked you or not.
Interview Questions: Why would i want to work there?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviews with manager, physicians, and co-workers. Long wait time in between interviews. Disconnect between hiring department and HR. Final interview stage was with HR to discuss salary and benefits.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict on a multi-disciplinary team?

title: ICU Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough so be truthful and honest. You will interview with Talent Acquisitions and if selected, you will interview with the person who will be your manager on that same day. You will then take a tour of your unit.
Interview Questions: What was the most memorable event at your last employment? Why did you leave? If given the chance, would you return to your last position?

title: Emergency Department Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable. I interviewed with the Manager of patient access, as well as the Supervisor. Was contacted within a week, for follow up human resources interview. Started within the month.
Interview Questions: If you were ever in a situation where a colleague was not doing there job, and it was directly affecting you, what would you do?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I' have interviewed for 2 positions at this company and both processes were pretty straightforward.  My initial hire into the organization involved meeting with HR and the Nurse Manager of the unit. Upon receiving an offer you need to pass a very difficult pharmacology test in order to be hired. For my 2 job I just interviewed with the Nurse Manager because I was an internal candidate.
Interview Questions: I can't remember a difficult or unexpected question, everything was pretty straight forward in both the interviews I've since being employed by this company.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Flushing, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was an open house interview.  After checking in, you are asked to wait in the auditorium before being called for the interview.  There were a large amount of candidates, thus the wait time varied for everyone.  I waited for about an hour before being called.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral questions and situational questions.

title: Patient Financial Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretyy standard interview you went in to a room with alot of other interviewees and managers sat with them at tables and answered questions at the end they let you ask questions, they were nice and easy going  they let you be you. Was told that they were ompressed wiht my credentials and that they would be contacting e with in the next few weeks or so for any necessary next steps in the hiring process.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest wekanedd

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very long process
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: One HR phone screen, one HR behavioral type interview and one manager interview. All happened within 2 weeks and process was smooth and relatively easy. After interviewing, I heard back the next week and got the offer. Took about one month to get on the schedule after background clearance and medical clearance.
Interview Questions: Why NYP

title: Summer Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, followed by a half day of interviews where you interview in front of panels of up to 5 managers at once. You are interviewing for up to a few positions at one time. Questions on the phone are about why you want to be in healthcare, why at NYP, and what about your experience makes you a good fit. During the half day, the questions are behavioral- tell us about a time when...
Interview Questions: We've read your resume, tell us something we don't know about you.

title: Nurse Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and organized.  Initial contact is phone screen, which is about 10 minutes.  Asks about current job, why do you want to move?, salary and expectations.   Then meet with 2 recruiters who use behavioral based interviewing.  They ask a lot of questions requiring you to give examples of specific responsibilities from your job history.  Pleasant experience.  Keeps you on your toes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a situation where if you had it to do over you would.  Explain.

title: Project Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: phone interview by HR rep., then one on one with hiring manager, then dept mgt and then vp of the division.  questions on past work history and skills.
Interview Questions: Why do you what to go into healthcare

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: At first I meet with HR, from there I had a meeting with the Floor manger and staff that worked that specific unit. Shortly after that I was contacted by HR again and she father
Interview Questions: what can you  contribute to NYP?

title: Clinical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with a talent recruiter. Talked about the role and some practical questions, in particular location of the position. It was basically the standard interview questions that can be expected, nothing out of the ordinary. The recruiter seemed professional and experienced.
Interview Questions: Not really any difficult nor unexpected questions.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, I received a call from a person in the HR department,  I had to fill out an online brief personality test, went in the for the one on one interview with the HR person, and then met with the manager of my specific floor as well as nurses from the floor I eventually got the job on.
Interview Questions: What made you want to be a nurse

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Tedious process. Have to interview at least three times. Meeting with recruiter in HR, then meeting manager, then meeting director of the dept. You are applying for and its staff. The latter is a group interview.  Communication was horrible during the process with the particular nurse recruiter I had.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this particular position in this area of nursing?

title: Maintenance Worker II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied Sept. 7 2013. 6 Weeks later Got a call for a interview, 2 days later was cancel due to supervisor of the department was on vacation. two weeks later got another interview date. got there everybody was ok. 5 days after got an offer and accepted.
Interview Questions: Easy Questions.

title: Unit Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I had two phone interviews regarding the position regarding my skills and the schedule they offered. Until i email the hr department they reach back to me telling me to take and pass 3 exam the next day.  Math, English and data entry. Interviewed with the supervisor and then director. After a month more they offered the position. all together 4 interviews. 
Question were pretty much the same and easy since i was ask some of the questions within my 4 interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell be about your most memorable customer experience?

title: Research Assistant(Volunteer) Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied by writing email to one of the coordinator of volunteer department. She sent me some materials and requirements. Then I had to enroll in a website and pass the necessary test. I had to complete medical examination. After that when I was offered the voluntary position I mentioned name of some departments. Later, I was called by one of those interview for an interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my current position and availability to work in their hospital

title: OR Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Was called and had a talk with the talent acquisition specialist who said there would be a follow up interview. The follow up interview never happened until I got the dreaded denial email.
Interview Questions: No curve balls

title: Security Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Basically, I was question by at least 7 managers at the same time in one room. Regular interview and resume back my time of hiring for the position.
Interview Questions: unexpected question was:" Can I handle the Value of visitor that enter this hospital daily."

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: They contact you via email, they setup a phone interview date. They ask you questions like "how did you hear about us? Why do you want to for NYP? Where do you see yourself in 5 years?"  Then you give you to choose a date to take the math and reading pre employment test. They just want to make sure you're not some idiot.  Once the exam is done you wait 2-3 weeks for a call/ email for a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: The test was actually the hardest part like some said. What threw me off was the email saying i had to take a Microsoft word, excel and data entry exam and when i got there it was just math and reading. 35 math 30reading multiple chose questions.

title: Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Cortlandt Manor, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Interviews with HR, department manager, department director, and team members - very in-depth, but reasonable, intelligent questions.  Slow-moving HR personnel.  Was offered an unreasonably low annual salary - I asked for more - they agreed to reconsider - but they countered with the same offer.
Interview Questions: Why doesn't the tough commute deter you?

title: Stock Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was called for two interviews. First one with a recruiter, the second one with the hiring manager. I thought everything was going great until I receive an email telling me I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter interviews you for the position, goes over some points on your resume, and then they test you on reading/vocab, math, and computer competency (such as seeing how fast you type numbers, patterns, and vocabulary), if you pass that you go on for a final interview with the nurse manager on the unit which is dominantly women so good luck.
Interview Questions: They ask about customer service experience and luxury hotel experience which surprised the S**t out of me. They also want to know why you parted ways from your previous employer/.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Thr interviewer asked questions about my experience and certifications, salary was discussed and my availability  for the shift that was available. He also asked if I was willing to relocate and if I had any physical  restrection, because the job requires lifting ,pushing and rolling.
Interview Questions: Will I be able to work the evening shift 3-11:30pm

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included situational questions, it was a panel interview with 4 staff member after I met with the manager. I was given a tour of the unit. The whole process took 1.5 hours
Interview Questions: Give an example of a change or improvement you initiated.

title: Ergonomics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was a pre-screening phone interview that was very brief. I was asked three questions and they were, 1. Why do you want to work for the organization? 2. What skills can you offer us? 3. What are your salary expectations?
Interview Questions: Ironically the the question that got me was about my salary expectations. As a college graduate, I guess I aimed too high asking for 40k-55k.

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
I had a phone interview with HR and then an in person with my supervisor, an in person interview with HR and then several in person interviews with coworkers.

HR asked me over the phone "why I wanted to work for NYP" and "what my salary expectations were."  I was terrified by the first and insulted by the second.  Obviously I did not name a specific figure.  HR seemed to hate me, but warmed up in my second interview.  The others went very well.  I was hired.
Interview Questions: Salary

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was pretty long. The first interview is with an HR recruiter, then if selected with your prospective manager. My interviews went well, but HR was very demanding when it came to information from your application. If you put something on your application, wither it is required for your position or not, it is important you have proof of it.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Nursing Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online. Received email regarding interview date. Interviewed with department manager and human resources (two interviews in one day). Each interview was about thirty minutes long. Before interview, a math test was required to be taken. Overall experience was good. Very straight forward.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you has conflicting priorities.

title: Medical Technologist Chemistry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR after 2 weeks of applying. HR rep asked me basic questions. Then met with core lab supervisors and was asked 'what would I do' type of scenarios. It was quick and straight to the point.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose NYP?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: This was 15 years ago.. Easy interview process, management made me feel relaxed.  I was able to do clinicals here during my undergraduate degree so I knew the culture of the institution and that really helped.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult patient?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty lengthy depending on what department you work in. The interview will take as many as three to five interviews. You should know a lot about the company as well as the department in which you will work in.
Interview Questions: The recruiter wanted a full length overview of your professional work history.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: the whole process of applying and getting the job took about a month. I was fortunate to have gotten an interview from an employee referral who worked on the unit and the nurse manager told me to apply online. A week later I got a phone call from talent acquisition for a brief phone interview, very basic questions regarding why NYP, why nursing, and going over the interview process and whether the shift was day or night, every other weekend, etc. Then they scheduled me to meet with someone from HR and the questions were very basic, many behavioral, be sure to have some examples in mind so you are not off guard and elaborate your examples, always showcase that you put the patient and their families first! Then right afterwards the HR manager asked me go meet with the nurse manager and I had a second interview with the nurse manager and assistant nurse manager of the floor. Afterwards I was given a tour of the unit and met with 2 of the floor nurses on the unit, kind of like an unofficial interview to see if I clicked with the other nurses on the unit. After all that I got an offer one week later, but it was dependent on whether you pass the written medication exam so that took another week to finally finalize whether I got the job or not. It was a long process, but it was positive, people were very nice.
Interview Questions: give an example of a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Employee Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Fairly ordinary.  Surprised that the most information I received during interview was about their benefits and I had to ask for information about the actual job.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where I had to convince management of something that was the right thing to do, but that they felt was wrong for their business.

title: Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was very long. I had the interview in March and was not hired until July. Human resources or Talent Acquisition has to do a better job in speeding up the process.
Interview Questions: Why Newyork Presbyterian?

title: Junior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from the manager. 3 rounds of interviews. Manager-HR-Manager. Then another call from HR for compensation. Overall easy interview, but that depends on the manager in question. Some are much easier than others.
Interview Questions: Do you know who we are?

title: Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: was asked questions about how to deal with situations and prioritize, how to resolve conflict, how to team work, how to treat co-workers. I was given phone interview first, then asked to come in for in-person interview, then was notified several weeks later, finally I was given offer
Interview Questions: what do you do when you have multiple things to deal with?

title: Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: they look at your resume. they look at your grades. they look at your letter of rec.  they have you interview with many faculty. they take you on a tour.  amazing things are happening here. the cat jumped over the hat.  why is there a 50 word minimum to this?
Interview Questions: why medicine?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Personality test, followed by a Phone interview, followed by HR interview, followed by an interview with a manager and another staff nurse. The entire process took months because of disorganization and miscommunication within the HR office. Upon signing the offer, a pharmacology exam was administered.
Interview Questions: Give an example of when a patient decompensated and how you handled it

title: Vendor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Casual, informal and friendly.  There was a need in the unit that I was able to provide in order to help patients feel comfortable, more relaxed and at ease.  I am happy that I am able to fill that need in some measure.
Interview Questions: How can you make the patient experience better?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview path was a long and arduous process from initial referral to phone screen to VP interview to management team interview. This took place over a five month time period until offer was extended.
Interview Questions: Provide examples to support accomplishments on resume

title: Blood Bank Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my online application, but I did not receive any phone call, It was my classmate who was working there gave my resume to the then manager, she called the human resources instead to give me an interview. it took almost for human resource staff to check out my references, then I start my job almost two months later.
Interview Questions: Educational background and previous work experience

title: Pharnacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Washington Heights, NY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. two days later i got an email from the HR department asking what was the best number to call and at what time. They called me the next day and i had about a 5 min phone interview. They asked me about my past pharmacy technician experience, why i left my last job and why i want to work for ny presbyterian. it was quick and easy. about two days later i got an email asking to call a number to set up a f2f interview. After i called i set up the closet interview date which was in 7 days. I got to the interview and took a 30 min math test, 30 min english/reading test and 10 min data entry test. math was REALLY basic. middle school basic. no calculators allowed. the whole thing overall was like a really easy SAT u can say. had to fill out some paperwork, give in a copy of my certification and sign a few sheets. about 20 mins later the HR senior recruiter came in. pretty normal interview. she stated that i had done a wonderful job on my tests and began the interview.
Interview Questions: is there a desicion u feel u made too quickly? what was it and why? describe a time where u had to take charge in  workplace. describe a time at work where u feel u showed ur leadership skills.... etc. pretty general questions but u def have to be prepared for the interview. she was pretty quick about asking and wanting me to answer.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was much more difficult than I had previously experienced regarding past internship interviews I'd been on prior to this. I'd say that this perspective was more based upon my anxiety, and not having known what to expect. I was interviewed 2-3 times in person, which was followed by a background and drug screening.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Laboratory Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I filled out an online application and submitted a CV through the hospital's website. A human resources rep contacted me by email the next day, offering two windows for a phone interview during the following week.  I emailed them back and chose the first window, which was 1.5 hours long.

On the day that I chose, the HR rep called me 20 minutes after the scheduled time window had ended.  They offered no apology or excuse.  It also seemed as if they were looking at my CV for the very first time as they asked me questions. They were also unable to pronounce the name of department that the laboratory served, which may seem like a petty detail, but was very off-putting to me.  In one of the final questions, they wanted to know if I had a job skill that was listed neither in the job description nor on my CV.

Overall, I was left with a sense that I was being screened by someone who had put little or no preparation into performing their job and a feeling of confusion about why they had contacted me in the first place.
Interview Questions: What is it about per diem work that interests you specifically?

title: Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I came in for an interview. It lasted about 30 minutes. I was asked some questions about previous employment. I was given some specifics about my job. I got a follow up call later for references and then met with HR.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews for entry level RN positions.  Most lower and mid- managers are promoted from within with a proven track record.  Usual type of interview questions.  Honest work best.  Interviews are conducted same as corporate.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was 9 years ago and the hiring process has evolved since then. From what I understand there is a much more rigorous interview process in place now than what I experienced then.
Interview Questions: Would you be afraid of working with a homeless population?

title: Senior Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Elmhurst, NY) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Met with a temp who was responsible for IT but had no idea what he was talking about twice.
Met with IT CIO twice then with the two people and they have no idea what they were saying, equipment-software they have. they have spent almost a million of dollars on equipment that has been sitting for months with no one that knows how to install it.
They have no active directory, still running windows nt and probably will for a while because they are so closed minded and would not listen to people that know what they are doing.
Interview Questions: name 5 steps you take to troubleshoot network?

title: Director Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy, encompassing many hiring managers over several sites - requiring many scheduling changes
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Mental Health Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: very positive,     its was a panel interviewand i was asked 5 questions per person  workiing in mental for 10 yrs before i got this job. love working with in mental health
Interview Questions: how well do you work with your co worker very well

title: Assistant Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't an unpleasant experience. The DON put me at ease and introduced herself in a professional friendly manner. The rest of the panel interviewed me individually and told me about the position and their expectation and asked me also about my expectations.
Interview Questions: The most challenging experience I have experienced in my nursing career.

title: Mental Health Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (White Plains, NY) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring took forever- I mean forever. I applied in December 2010 and I have not heard back until March 2011. It is not much better now... either you know someone or I do not know how you  get there... everyone who works there is related to someone else.. there are entire families working- mother in kitchen, father cleaning, son at the unit, daughter in administration- you get the drift.
Interview Questions: Once you get the interview, you get the job, no matter what you say. The referral is what counts.

title: Desktop Support Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: You'll first have a phone interview, which you'll be asked basic tech questions. The 1 -3 in person interviews. Also you'll be tested for TB twice which is a 2 week long process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with referral from current pharmacist. Called for initial interview after 4+weeks. Offered position after three total interviews. The first interview was a brief phone call, the interviewer had questions about my experience, once cleared she set up a time to meet in person. This lead to two interviews in one day, the first with a pleasant HR representative followed by a separate interview with the Pharmacy Manager. Additionally, I came in also to take a pharmaceutical math test (but this was after I accepted the position during the orientation phase).
Interview Questions:
The questions were very easy to answer. Mainly "tell me about yourself" questions where you simply align your skill, talents, strengths, and past experiences with the job description. None of the questions were really challenging, unless you aren't aware of why you want the job, other than procuring a means for financial security. 

Some of the questions included, how does your professional goals align with NYPH vision? Are you a certified pharmacy technician, if not, do you plan on acquiring certification in the next 6-12months?

title: Security Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: the hiring process is fast if your match what they are looking for. All medical test drug test that they need is done on site. I was give a test, i also went through an orientation process
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Laboratory Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview, the interview went well but it took them very long time to do background check and reference check. Took over a month.
Interview Questions: What do you want to work for NYP?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: My resume was passed on from a colleague and two people from the company called to interview me about two different positions  My first interview was with the manager and bypassed HR. The interview went well. The interviewer asked the same canned interview questions.
Interview Questions: What would you offer NYP on the red carpet?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: text interviews
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Marketing and Public Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Peekskill, NY) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process for professional and the people are nice. I was treated fairly. I responded to an ad in the newspaper, which was followed by an interview with HR and the hiring manager, then an interview with the other "ladies" in the department, I guess to see if I was a good fit, and then an interview with the president of the hospital.  I had to wiat nearly three weeks to find out that I did not get the job.  Follwoing my interview with the president , there was such a lag that I thoough they had made a decision, so I wrote a note.  I was told that were still intervwing.  It was a long process.
Interview Questions: How would the the Preisdent at the other hopsital you work discribe you.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: they call you twice for phone interview. Then, they email me to have me meet with the recruiter. The final interview was with the unit manager. Then you have to fill out a stack of paper work.
Interview Questions: explain to me how you handle one of your most challenging day

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Preliminary interview with HR followed by an interview with the supervisor I would be reporting to one month later. Took almost two months later to be notified with an offer.
Interview Questions: No extremely difficult questions.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: It did not feel like an interview at all. It was more of them telling me the benefits of the position then asking me very light questions about why I wanted to work in that department as opposed to others. They then asked me if I had any questions, but after they told me so much all the questions I had planned had already been answered.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in (the department) rather than the other departments?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Flushing, NY) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth at least for me. I worked with my supervisor before on another project while working with other hospital. So, I have known them already and everything was very smooth.....
Interview Questions: Whom I want to meet most in my future, from my past and why.....

title: PFS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great and easy
Interview Questions: Taking the test was the most difficult

title: Patient Service Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (New York, NY) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very professional and comftorable. Its done in a very nice environment and the manager is warm and non intimidating. The employees for the most part on the other hand behave very unprofessional which makes one wonder if this is the best working environment for one self. If you need the money then what can you do, but if you have options it may be best to use them.
Interview Questions: Honestly cant think of a difficult question asked.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital (Cortland, NY) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was made very comfortable questions pertained to clinical experience and knowledge.
Interview Questions: What could I bring to the unit and asked how  would I handle a disgruntled family member.
